oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: NBC Bandstand - 1958-12-05 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of NBC Bandstand radio show hosted by Bert Parks, with Skitch Henderson and Dody Goodman. Originally broadcast December 5, 1958, and featuring WSM and Grand Ole Opry musicians to celebrate the 1000th Opry broadcast including announcer Dave Overton, Marvin Hughes and the WSM Orchestra, the Anita Kerr Quartet, Don Gibson, Dottie Dillard, Minnie Pearl, Faron Young, Hank Garland, and the Jordanaires. It is mentioned (in part 2) that KSTP of Minneapolis, MN is celebrating its thirtieth year as an NBC affiliate, and David Stone (former WSM announcer) is noted as the MC of KSTP's Sunset Valley Barn Dance.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Marvin Hughes; WSM Orchestra; Anita Kerr Quartet; Don Gibson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening theme -- Opening statement (Bert Parks) -- Opening statement (Dave Overton) -- Bert Parks introduces Marvin Hughes -- The Song Is You (Marvin Hughes and the WSM Orchestra) -- Bert Parks and Skitch Henderson talk -- Ex-Lax commercial (Bert Parks) -- Dave Overton introduces the Anita Kerr Quartet -- Somebody Stole My Gal (Anita Kerr Quartet) -- U. S. Steel commercial (Bert Parks) -- Bert Parks and Skitch Henderson talk about the Grand Ole Opry and WSM -- Bert Parks introduces Don Gibson -- Oh Lonesome Me (Don Gibson) -- Bert Parks and Skitch Henderson talk
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: National Broadcasting Company; WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Parks, Bert; Henderson, Skitch, 1918-2005; Goodman, Dody; Overton, Dave; Anita Kerr Quartet; Minnie Pearl; Young, Faron; Jordanaires (Musical group); Gibson, Don (Donald Eugene), 1928-2003; Dillard, Dottie; Hughes, Marvin; WSM Orchestra; Devine, Ott, 1910-1994; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Carroll, Madeleine, 1906-1987
